generif.text: Both TGFbeta and flow shear stimulated expression of CITED2 and also association of CIT-ED2 with p300 by dissociating Ets-1 from p300. Thus, CITED2 plays a major role in shear-induced down-regulation of MMP-1 and MMP-13 via a TGFbeta-dependent pathway.
CIT-ED2 is a coactivator of PPARalpha and both proteins may participate in signaling cascades of hypoxic response and angiogenesis
CITED2 mutations have a causative impact in the development of CHD in humans.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
TGF-beta-mediated down-regulation of Cited2 is post-transcriptional, through the Smad pathway, and requires the presence of its coding sequence
Cited2, a coactivator of HNF4alpha, is essential for liver development
CITED2 regulates colon cancer invasion and might be a target for histone deacetylase inhibitor-based intervention of colon cancer.
CITED2 and PBX1 are likely to be important mediators of adrenal development and function in humans, but mutations in these genes are not common causes of adrenal failure.

The effects of endothelial-cell-conditioned medium (ECCM), as produced during the incubation of human umbilical vein endothelial cells for 24 h, on the promoter activity and mRNA and protein expression of CITED2 in adrenocortical cells, was examined.
Reducing CITED2 expression in a mammary tumor cell line inhibits the establishment of bone metastasis and osteolysis in vivo.
Both NCOR2 and CITED2 mRNA levels were associated with MFS, that is, tumour aggressiveness, independently of traditional prognostic factors
CITED2 may act as a mechanosensitive molecular switch regulating cartilage matrix breakdown.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
CITED2 is a novel regulator of NF-kappaB in the nucleus, which reveals a negative feedback mechanism for NF-kappaB signaling.
CITED2 activation may induce mucosal apoptosis and erosion by activating p53 and thus play a critical role in linking enteric bacteria with mucosal inflammation in ulcerative colitis.
A combination of cisplatin and CITED2 shRNA may represent an effective treatment against p53-sensitive cancer cells.
We conclude that mutations in CITED2 may be involved in premature ovarian failure pathogenesis.

CITED2 variants decreased its ability to mediate the expression of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and the expression of the paired-like homeodomain transcription factor 2-gamma (PITX2C), both of which are closely related to cardiac development.
CITED2 functions as a molecular switch of TGF-alpha and TGF-beta-induced growth control, and MYC-CITED2 signaling axis provides a new index for predicting clinical outcome.
CITED2 is phosphorylated by MAPK1 in vitro at T166, and that MAPK1 activation enhances the coactivation function of CITED2 but not of CITED2-T166N.
CITED2 is a direct effector of PPARgamma for tumor suppression.
data indicate that CITED2 functions as a transcriptional co-activator of ER in breast cancer cells and that its increased expression in tumors may result in estrogen-independent ER activation
Our study suggests that CITED2 gene mutations and methylation may play an important role in the development of pediatric congenital heart disease.
CITED2 has a potential causative impact on congenital heart disease

The increased CITED2 expression in acute myeloid leukemia results in better hematopoietic stem cell survival, lower PU.1 levels, and perturbed myeloid differentiation program that contributes to leukemia persistence.
FBXL5-mediated degradation of CITED2 leads to the activation of HIF-1 alpha.
High Cited2 level in cumulus cells was associated with low embryo quality and pregnancy outcome in in vitro fertilization patients.
Intrinsic protein disorder plays a prominent role in the function and interactions of the transcriptional co-activators CBP and p300. (Review)
CITED2 plays important roles in the progression and chemoresistance of breast carcinoma and that CITED2 status is a potent prognostic factor in breast cancer patients.
down-regulation of Cited2 was associated with high glucose-induced apoptosis in cardiomyocytes in vitro
CITED2 regulates primary breast tumor growth, likely by influencing tumor vasculature via TGF-beta-dependent regulation of VEGFA.
the downregulation of CITED2 contributes to TGFbeta-mediated senescence.

Through allosteric enhancement of HIF-1alpha release, CITED2 activates a highly responsive negative feedback circuit that rapidly and efficiently attenuates the hypoxic response, even at modest CITED2 concentrations.

The results suggest that CITED2 mutations in conserved regions lead to disease-causing biological and functional changes and may contribute to the occurrence of conotruncal heart defects in Chinese children.
CITED2 supports gastric cancer cell colony formation and proliferation while inhibiting apoptosis making it a potential gene therapy target for gastric cancer.
CITED2 gene mutation may play a significant role in the development of pediatric congenital heart disease.

Knockdown of CITED2 led to a decreased interaction of p53 with its inhibitor MDM2, which results in increased amounts of total p53 protein. Data indicate that CITED2 functions in pathways regulating p53 activity.
Observations identify CITED2 as a novel negative regulator of macrophage proinflammatory activation that protects the host from inflammatory insults.

GINS2 plays an important role in cell proliferation and apoptosis of thyroid cancer by regulating the expressions of CITED2 and LOXL2, which may be a potential biomarker for diagnosis or prognosis and a drug target for therapy.

CITED2 acts as a molecular chaperone to guide PRMT5 and p300 to nucleolin, thereby activating nucleolin. Informatics and experimental data suggest that the CITED2-nucleolin axis is involved in prostate cancer metastasis.
The results showed that the core promoter area of MUC5AC was located within the 935/+48 region and that P300 reduced the expression of MUC5AC in A549 cells.
tested the hypothesis that CITED2 mediates cross-talk between IL-4 signaling and mechanical loading-induced pathways that result in chondroprotection, at least in part, by downregulating MMP13
These findings illustrate that combined PU.1/CITED2 deregulation induces a transcriptional program that promotes HSPC maintenance, which might be a prerequisite for malignant transformation.

Bioinformatics assay results showed that these novel cited2 mutations alter the RNA folding, protein structure, and, therefore, probable effect on the protein function and may play a significant role in the development of congenital heart diseases
Genetic analysis of the CITED2 gene promoter in isolated and sporadic congenital ventricular septal defects.
Downregulation of SUV39H1 and CITED2 Exerts Additive Effect on Promoting Adipogenic Commitment of Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells.
A gain-of-function mutation in CITED2 is associated with congenital heart disease.
CITED2 alleviates lipopolysaccharide-induced inflammation and pyroptosis in - human lung fibroblast by inhibition of NF-kappaB pathway.
CITED2 is a conserved regulator of the uterine-placental interface.
Identification and Functional Verification of CITED2 Gene Promoter Region in Patients with Patent Ductus Arteriosus.

name: Cbp/p300 interacting transactivator with Glu/Asp rich carboxy-terminal domain 2

reactome.name: Regulation of gene expression by Hypoxia-inducible Factor
Transcriptional regulation by the AP-2 (TFAP2) family of transcription factors
TFAP2 (AP-2) family regulates transcription of other transcription factors
Activation of the TFAP2 (AP-2) family of transcription factors
FOXO-mediated transcription of cell death genes

summary: The protein encoded by this gene inhibits transactivation of HIF1A-induced genes by competing with binding of hypoxia-inducible factor 1-alpha to p300-CH1. Mutations in this gene are a cause of cardiac septal defects. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding multiple isoforms have been observed for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, May 2012].
